com.example.kappapridesms

Class MessageFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.kappapridesms.MessageFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener, android.widget.SearchView.OnCloseListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, BlacklistDialog.BlacklistDialogListener, ForwardDialog.ForwardDialogListener, WarningDialog.WarningDialogListener

    public class MessageFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements ForwardDialog.ForwardDialogListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener, android.widget.SearchView.OnCloseListener, WarningDialog.WarningDialogListener, BlacklistDialog.BlacklistDialogListener
    This fragment is what contains all of the functionality of messaging between another contact.

    Contains 13 private attributes and instances:

    - m_fragView

    - m_messageRecyclerView

    - s_messageViewAdapter

    - m_deleteActive

    - m_deleteView

    - m_warningDialog

    - m_forwardActive

    - m_forwardContent

    - m_forwardDialog

    - m_errorDialog

    - m_blacklistActive

    - m_blacklistContent

    - m_blacklistDialog

    Contains 15 public methods:

                                                 @Nullable
                                                 android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Method called to have the fragment instantiate its user interface view.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater - The object that can be used to inflate any views in teh fragment.
        container - If non-null, this is the parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to. This is used to generate the LayoutParams of the view. The value may be null.
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given by this parameter.
        Returns:
        The UI view of the fragment.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(Conversation targetConversation,
                        java.lang.String messageContent)
        Method that is called to send a message. It uses two parameters to determine the conversation to send it in and what it will send.
        Parameters:
        targetConversation - The conversation to send the message in.
        messageContent - String value that holds what the message is.
